citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An IACUC approved surgical protocol includes a laparotomy procedure in swine. The written narrative description of the
methods and sources used to determine that alternatives to that procedure were not available refers to the use of a
database search. However, none of the terms used in the database search strategy pertained to the specific surgical
procedure contained in the proposal.
Per this section of the regulations, whenever a proposal for animal use contains procedures that may cause more than
momentary pain or distress to the animals, the IACUC shall determine that (1) the principal investigator has considered
alternatives to those procedures and (2) that the written narrative description of the methods and sources used by the
principal investigator to determine that alternatives were not available adequately addresses all of the potentially painful
procedures contained in the proposal. These requirements ensure that all procedures contained in the protocol minimize
discomfort, distress, and pain to the animals.
To be corrected by September 1st, 2024.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An IACUC approved protocol indicates that 5 animals will be used, but does not provide justification for the
appropriateness of the number of animals for the research.
Another IACUC approved protocol indicates a need for 4 groups of 3 animals to achieve "statistical significance," but does
not include the details of how that statistical analysis was conducted, such as the tests used or statisticians consulted.
Failure to include a rationale for the number of animals to be used in animal use protocols compromises the ability of the
IACUC to evaluate the appropriateness of the numbers of animals requested. Per this section of the regulations, all
proposals for animal use must include a rationale for the appropriateness of the species and numbers of animals to be
used.
To be corrected by September 1st, 2024.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An IACUC approved protocol for surgical device testing does not provide a complete description of the proposed use of
animals. Laparotomy is mentioned in the procedures section of the protocol but there is no description of the surgical
procedure. There are no specifics included as to the role of animals in the study design or the various laparoscopic
procedures that may be involved in device testing.
In order for the IACUC to fulfill their responsibilities and ensure that pain and distress are minimized to that which is
scientifically necessary, all proposals to conduct activity involving animals must contain a complete description of the
proposed use of animals.
To be corrected by September 1st, 2024.
This inspection and initial exit interview were conducted with facility representatives on site. A final exit briefing was
conducted on July 2, 2024 with the Institutional Official, Attending Veterinarian, and IACUC coordinators.
